alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Floyd; Hall; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 9:13PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Floyd, northwestern Motley, Hall and southeastern Briscoe Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 913 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Brice to 3 miles south of Valley Schools to 6 miles southwest of Aiken. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Memphis, Turkey, Caprock Canyon State Park, Lockney, Quitaque, South Plains, Aiken, Brice, Flomot, Valley Schools, Northfield, Lakeview, and Plaska Community. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for the Panhandle of and northwestern Texas.
